SUMMARY: HipB is antitoxin of HipAB toxin-antitoxin system. HipAB toxin-antitoxin system appears to be regulated at level of HipB stability. Degradation of HipB is mainly dependent on Lon protease, and is dependent on an unstructured 16 amino acid domain at C terminus of protein [22720069]. A bioinformatic analysis revealed that re are a total of 39 HipB-binding palindromic sequences, TATCCN(x)GGATA, in promoter regions of 33 genes in Escherichia coli genome, where N represents any nucleotide and x is number of nucleotides, from 1 to 30. functions of se 33 genes are involved in different processes, such as persistence, metabolism, transcriptional regulation, mismatch repair, membrane proteins, transporter proteins, and inner membrane proteins [24089053]. HipB: high persistence [6348026].
